articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Harare
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Arrives in Harare
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, arrived in Harare Monday to visit the Republic of Zimbabwe.
					 Accompanying him were Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun and other suite members.
					
					 Kim and his party were greeted at the airport by Vice-President of Zimbabwe Joyce Teurai Ropa Mujuru, Prime Minister Morgan Richard Tsvangirai, vice-prime ministers Arthur Guseni Mutambara and Thokozani Khupe, Foreign Minister Simbarashe Mumbengegwi and Minister of Industry and Commerce Welshman Ncube and diplomatic envoys of different countries there.
					
					 A welcome ceremony for Kim Yong Nam took place at the airport.
					
					 He announced an arrival statement.

articles.title: Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Robert G. Mugabe Held
articles.content:
Talks between Kim Yong Nam and Robert G. Mugabe Held
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Robert G. Mugabe, President of Zimbabwe, at the presidential palace in Harare on May 11.
					 At the talks Mugabe said that he boundlessly reveres President Kim Il Sung who rendered full support and encouragement to the Zimbabwean people's struggle for national liberation and their building of a new society.
					
					 Congratulating the DPRK on its achievements including the successful satellite launch, he said that these are giving confidence and courage to the Zimbabweans.
					
					 The Songun politics is the just politics that everyone should follow, he stressed.
					
					 At the talks both sides discussed the matter of boosting the long-standing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two counties and exchanged views on matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Present there were Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun and Ambassador to Zimbabwe An Hui Jong of the DPRK and Foreign Minister of Zimbabwe Simbarashe Mumbengegwi.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Feted by Zimbabwean President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Feted by Zimbabwean President
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Zimbabwean President Robert G. Mugabe hosted a banquet at the presidential palace Monday in honor of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on a visit to his country.
					 Present there on invitation were Kim Yong Nam, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun, DPRK Ambassador to Zimbabwe An Hui Jong and other suite members.
					
					 Present there were Robert G. Mugabe, Vice-President of Zimbabwe Joyce Teurai Ropa Mujuru, vice-prime ministers, the minister of Foreign Affairs, the minister of Justice, commanders of the army, the police superintendent general and others and diplomatic envoys of different countries there.
					
					 Robert G. Mugabe in his speech said that Zimbabwe felt grateful to the government and people of the DPRK for having sent strong support and encouragement to his government and people in their struggle for the country's independence and the building of a new society.
					
					 The revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung has always given confidence and inspiration to the Zimbabwean people in their struggle and he will always be remembered by all people along with history, he added.
					
					 Noting that he was pleased with the relations between the two countries favorably developing with each passing day, he expressed the will to make positive efforts to boost them. 
					
					 Kim Yong Nam in his speech said that the DPRK and Zimbabwe are far away from each other geographically but they forged close ties of friendship long ago and have developed the cooperative relations. 
					
					 He recalled that Kim Il Sung sent support and encouragement, both material and moral, to the Zimbabwean people in their struggle for national liberation and the building of a new society, regarding President Robert G. Mugabe as a close friend and comrade-in-arms. 
					
					 Saying that the DPRK is opposed to all sanctions against Zimbabwe and interference in its internal affairs and supports the government and people of Zimbabwe in their efforts to achieve political stability and economic development of the country, he stressed that the DPRK would make positive efforts to boost the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation in various fields between the two countries in the future, too.

articles.title: DPRK-China Friendship City Meeting Held
articles.content:
DPRK-China Friendship City Meeting Held
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The DPRK-China friendship city meeting was held here Tuesday.
					 Present there were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who is chairman of the Korean City Federation, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the committee, delegates of the committee and federation, delegates of South Hwanghae Province, Kangwon Province, South Phyongan Province, Rason City, Nampho City, Hamhung City, Chongjin City, Mangyongdae District of Pyongyang which have friendly relations with cities of China and officials concerned.
					
					 A delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Wu Donghe and delegates from the provinces of Jiangxi, Shandong and Sichuan and the cities of Shanghai, Jilin, Hunchun and Changchun and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Liu Xiaoming were also present there.
					
					 Mun Jae Chol in a report said since the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and China 60 years ago cities in the two countries have conducted exchange and cooperation in various fields thus making a substantial contribution to the development of the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 He referred to the fact that the friendly relations were established between Hamhung and Shanghai in 1982 and in the subsequent period friendly relations were forged between Kangwon Province and Jiangxi Province, between South Hwanghae Province and Shandong Province, between South Phyongan Province and Sichuan Province and between Mangyongdae District of Pyongyang and Jilin City of Jilin Province and other cities.
					
					 He hoped that the friendly cities would significantly decorate the "year of DPRK-China friendship" through peculiar exchanges and thus positively contribute to consolidating and developing the DPRK-China friendship, a precious treasure common to the two peoples.
					
					 Wu Donghe, speaking next, said that it is of particularly great significance to hold a friendship city meeting in Pyongyang on the occasion of "year of China-DPRK friendship," 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					
					 He said that the exchange and cooperation between the friendly cities conducted under the deep concern of the leaders and governments of the two countries positively contributed to inheriting and developing the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					He sincerely hoped that the people of the DPRK would attain the grandiose goal of opening the gate to a thriving nation in 2012 as set by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Chinese ambassador made a congratulatory speech to be followed by speeches of delegates of the South Hwanghae Provincial People's Committee, the Mangyongdae District, Pyongyang, People's Committee, the Shandong Provincial People's Government and the Jilin City People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries of Jilin Province. 
					
					 A joint press release was made public there.
					
					 The press release noted that the meeting, the first of its kind in the history of the DPRK-China friendly relations, looked back on the history and tradition of friendship and emphasized that the DPRK-China friendship is a treasure common to the two peoples as they were provided and fostered by the revolutionaries of the elder generation including President Kim Il Sung and Chairman Mao Zedong.
					
					 It said that the meeting expressed the will of the friendly cities to expand and develop exchange and cooperation on the principle of mutual benefit as expected by the top leaders of the two countries and thus positively contribute to glorifying the significant "year of DPRK-China friendship."
					
					 The Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Korean City Federation hosted a banquet at Chongryu Restaurant to hail the success of the meeting on the same day.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegations
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Chinese Delegations
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with the Chinese delegations participating in the Korea-China friendship city meeting at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today. They are the delegation of the China-Korea Friendship Association led by Chairman Wu Donghe and the Chinese local government delegation headed by Vice-Chairman of the Sichuan Provincial People's Association for Friendship with Foreign Countries Wang Xian which groups people's government delegates from the provinces of Jiangxi, Shandong and Sichuan and the cities of Shanghai, Jilin, Hunchun and Changchun.
					 Present on the occasion were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Congratulations to PM of Algeria
articles.content:
Congratulations to PM of Algeria
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il on Monday sent a congratulatory message to Ahmed Ouyahia upon his reappointment as Prime Minister of Algeria.
					The message wished the Prime Minister greater success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Congratulations to Algerian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Congratulations to Algerian Foreign Minister
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun on Monday sent a congratulatory message to Mourad Medelci upon his reappointment as foreign minister of Algeria.
					 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to strengthen and develop, the message wished him happiness in good health and greater success in the performance of his responsible job.

articles.title: Talks with Zimbabwean Government Delegation Held
articles.content:
Talks with Zimbabwean Government Delegation Held
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Talks were held between the delegation of the DPRK Ministry of People's Security and the Zimbabwean government delegation at the Mansudae Assembly Hall here on Tuesday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the delegation of the ministry headed by Minister Ju Sang Song and from the opposite side were members of the government delegation led by Minister of Interior Kembo Campbell Dugishmohadi.
					
					 At the talks both sides discussed the matter of boosting exchange and cooperation between security organs of the two countries and exchanged views on a series of matters of mutual concern.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Zimbabwean Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Zimbabwean Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting Zimbabwean government delegation.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned on Tuesday by Kembo Campbell Dugishmohadi, minister of Interior of Zimbabwe who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The participants of the DPRK-China friendship city meeting laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill on Tuesday.
					 They placed the floral basket before the statue and made deep bows to it in humble reverence for the President who made undying contributions to the strengthening and development of the DPRK-China friendship.

articles.title: DPRK Ministry Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
articles.content:
DPRK Ministry Delegation Leaves for Mongolia
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Ministry of Land and Environmental Conservation led by Minister Pak Song Nam left here today to participate in the Northeast Asian ministerial-level meeting on climate change to be held in Mongolia.

articles.title: FIFA Futsal Coaching Course Held in DPRK
articles.content:
FIFA Futsal Coaching Course Held in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A FIFA futsal coaching course was held at the Table-Tennis Gymnasium in Chongchun Street from May 5 to 9.
					 The course was attended by football coaches of sports teams.
					
					 The basic movement, defence and attack tactics of the futsal and other issues were dealt with in the course.
					
					 The course was given by Martic Mico, a futsal lecturer of FIFA.

articles.title: AFC Coach (Class A) Qualification Course
articles.content:
AFC Coach (Class A) Qualification Course
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- An AFC coach (class A) qualification course was held between April 17 and May 10 at Kim Il Sung Stadium of the DPRK.
					 Participating in the course were 24 coaches selected from those of different sports teams who had possessed qualifications for coach (class B) of the AFC in the past and 6 observers.
					
					 The course put main emphasis on team tactics such as offensive and defensive tactics and shooting under standard circumstances and also dealt with psychology, physiological anatomy and other issues.
					
					 Eghbali Ghahyazi Masoud, a football lecturer of the AFC, officiated the course.

articles.title: FINA Development Water-Polo Coaches Clinic Held
articles.content:
FINA Development Water-Polo Coaches Clinic Held
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A FINA development water-polo coaches clinic was held between May 7 and 11 at the Indoor Swimming Pool in Chongchun Street.
					It was attended by water-polo coaches of various sports teams and relevant researchers.
					
					 The clinic dealt with the developing trend of modern water-polo techniques, basic techniques, shooting techniques, training methods and others.
					
					 Shagaev Erkin, a water-polo lecturer of the FINA, gave lectures at the clinic.

articles.title: World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent Observed
articles.content:
World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent Observed
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- An event was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Tuesday to mark World Day of Red Cross and Red Crescent.
					 Attending it were officials of the Central Committee of the Red Cross Society of the DPRK, officials concerned and members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies and the delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross active in the DPRK.
					
					 Present there on invitation were diplomatic envoys of various countries and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 Briefings on the first-aid services, health agitation activities and emergency activities to cope with disasters conducted by the Red Cross Society of the DPRK were given at the event before introducing the cooperation activities being conducted by the above-said international bodies in the DPRK.

articles.title: New Bio-beauty Mask Getting Popular
articles.content:
New Bio-beauty Mask Getting Popular
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The bio-beauty mask developed by the Life Science Department of Kim Il Sung University are now popular among the users at home and abroad.
					 Various kinds of beauty masks had previously been developed for the purpose of preventing the aging of skin cells, but they had many shortcomings.
					
					The new mask is a product of natural materials, which are rich in natural active materials such as Î±-oxyacid, vitamins and amino acids obtained by bioengineering technology. It is completely free from side effect. And it is much more durable and softer than the existing facial masks made of paper and cloth. A functional product, it begins to prove effective in two or three days after application.
					
					 Dr. Han Kyong Ae, an associate professor, who developed it, said:
					
					The bio-beauty mask helps clean the face, prevent aging and add beauty.
					
					  Unlike other beauty masks, it is most efficacious in removing pimples. It has overall effects in removing pigmentation such as freckles and black spots, smoothening wrinkles and making the face soft and white.
					
					 It prevents old-age spots often seen on the faces of senescent persons and gives whitening effect by promoting specialization and fertility of skin.
					
					Its scope of usage unlimited, the bio-beauty mask is sought after even by elders and male, not to speak of young women. It was awarded the DPRK invention diploma and special prize and first prize at national public presentations of science and technology and exhibitions in the biological field.
					
					 Displayed at the Northeast Asia Ultra Modern Technology Expo held in China in September, Juche 96 (2007) and at an international trade fair in Pyongyang, it drew keen interests of visitors and its mysterious efficacy became widely known to the world to increase the demand for it.
					
					Pak Kyong Hui, 29, working at the Pyongyang Maternity Hospital, said she had been annoyed by pimples for 11 years, but the beauty masks made her face clean and white so much that others could hardly recognize her.

articles.title: KCNA Urges U.S. to Rectify Its Biased Nuclear Policy
articles.content:
KCNA Urges U.S. to Rectify Its Biased Nuclear Policy
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Hans Blix, ex-director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency, when interviewed by Vremya Novostey in Moscow on April 23, said that in order to realize the worldwide nuclear disarmament the U.S. and other nuclear powers should set "an example."
					 He deplored that the "nuclear powers" are demanding other countries observe the nuclear discipline while violating the NPT regime. Some countries' access to nuclear weapons, therefore, presents itself as an issue of defending themselves from the U.S., among other things, he added.
					
					 This cannot but be a universally accepted and just logic.
					
					 It is the unanimous desire and wish of humankind to live in the world completely free from nuclear weapons and the threat of a nuclear war.
					
					 However, there are on earth a very large number of nukes enough to destroy it more than a hundred times. This is very adversely affecting mankind's peace and development.
					
					 It is the keynote of the U.S. strategy to establish world domination on the basis of its unchallenged nuclear position.
					
					 The U.S. nuclear doctrine "Those with nuclear weapons dominate the world" still remains unchanged.
					
					The U.S., the first nuclear war criminal state that imposed a nuclear disaster upon humankind, has followed the road of large-scale buildup of nuclear forces and their expansion. About 20,000 nuclear warheads are stockpiled in the U.S. nuclear arsenal which are much more than the nuclear warheads of other nuclear weapons states put together.
					
					 The U.S. is putting spurs to beefing up modern nuclear forces, still regarding a preemptive nuclear strike as a main task of its military strategy in the 21st century.
					
					 The commander of the U.S. Air Force Strategic Command asserted that the U.S. Department of Defense should develop improved nuclear weapons as means to beat back attacks from other countries in the 21st century.
					
					 The department recently kicked off the research into using SM-3 on the ground. The move to put SM-3 now aboard Aegis ships under a new system whereby they can be fired on the ground reveals part of the U.S. modernization of the nuclear weapons system.
					
					 Last year the U.S. spent at least 52.4 billion U.S. dollars for the development and modernization of nuclear weapons.
					
					 All facts go to prove that the U.S. is pushing forward the modernization of nukes in real earnest by channeling a stupendous amount of funds into their development behind the scene of "nuclear disarmament." 
					
					 The U.S. nuclear threat to the DPRK, in particular, has steadily increased in the recent period. 
					
					 Walter Sharp, commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea, recently blustered that the U.S. would be firmly committed to providing a nuclear umbrella to south Korea, asserting that the "U.S.-south Korea Mutual Defense Treaty" would remain valid even after the transfer of the "right to command wartime operations" to south Korea.
					
					 The U.S. pressure upon the DPRK to dismantle its nukes, while talking about the "provision of a nuclear umbrella to south Korea," is little short of forcing it to lay down arms.
					
					 It was entirely just for the DPRK to have acquired nuclear deterrent for self-defence to cope with the ever-more undisguised moves of the U.S. for a nuclear war.
					
					 Those with nukes can be countered only in kind.
					
					 The world is now compelled to take the road of a nuclear arms race due to the U.S. nuclear war moves whether it likes or not.
					
					 It is self-evident that the U.S. national strategy should be changed as it was based on the conception that only the U.S. is allowed to boost its nuclear capability and other countries of the world can be pressurized not to manufacture such weapons.
					
					 Such practice of the U.S. as taking issue with others' nuclear deterrents, while pursuing its ambitious nuclear policy as it pleases, is bound to trigger off protest against its nuclear policy and spark off a global nuclear arms race.
					
					 If a definite end is to be put to the nuclear arms race, the U.S., the world's biggest nuclear power, should rectify its nuclear policy as early as possible.

articles.title: Outbursts of Commander of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Lambasted
articles.content:
Outbursts of Commander of U.S. Forces in S. Korea Lambasted
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The commander of the U.S. forces in south Korea recently let loose a spate of balderdash that the south Korea-U.S. "mutual defense treaty" will remain valid though the "right to command wartime operations" is transferred to south Korea and the "U.S. is firmly committed to providing a nuclear umbrella" to south Korea and the like. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: These outbursts were prompted by the U.S. desire to give a shot in the arm of the puppets running helter-skelter after being isolated internally and externally for frantically pursuing confrontation with fellow countrymen and, at the same time, dare to stifle the DPRK with military threat and blackmail against it.
					
					  He went the lengths of blustering that south Korea and the U.S. would maintain the posture of prompt combat actions on the basis of OPLAN 5027 and OPLAN 5029, talking about someone's "emergency situation." These remarks cannot be interpreted otherwise than unpardonable bellicose outbursts hurting the supreme dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The U.S. call for "maintaining the posture of prompt combat actions" is little short of a declaration that it has rounded off its scenario for a nuclear war of aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 What merits serious attention is that the puppets are zealously joining the U.S. in its reckless moves to ignite a nuclear war of aggression against the DPRK. This is evidenced by the fact that the puppets claimed that they are "at the phase in which their counter proposal was put into a concrete plan." This is nothing but a reckless behavior to bring the inter-Korean relations to total collapse and do harm to compatriots at any cost.
					
					 As seen above, the recently disclosed sinister scenario of the U.S. and puppet war-thirsty forces to unleash a war goes to clearly prove that their moves for a nuclear war against the DPRK have reached a reckless phase of its implementation. The warmongers may ignite a nuclear war any time.
					
					 Their escalated moves for a nuclear war against the DPRK would only prompt the DPRK to hold higher the banner of Songun to deal deadly blows at the aggressors, provokers.

articles.title: U.S. Fresh Military Moves Slashed
articles.content:
U.S. Fresh Military Moves Slashed
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Some days ago, the U.S. Navy brought  what it called ultra-modern type Aegis destroyers to south Korea. In this regard the U.S. imperialist bellicose forces announced that they would be involved in joint military maneuvers with warships belonging to the 1st fleet of the south Korean puppet navy. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:  
					
					 The projected joint military maneuvers are dangerous military moves to put their scenario for the second Korean war into practice as they are aimed to deteriorate the situation and create conditions and environment for mounting a preemptive attack on the DPRK. 
					
					 It is the invariable scenario of the U.S. imperialist war-thirsty forces for invading the DPRK to start a new war at any cost on the Korean Peninsula and settle the Korean issue by force, the commentary says, and goes on: 
					
					 Having already mapped out a detailed military operation plan to stifle the DPRK, the U.S. is watching for a chance to put it into practice.
					
					 Under the grave situation where the U.S. and the south Korean puppets are very keen to stifle the DPRK by force of arms at any cost, talking about "emergency situation" the DPRK cannot remain a passive onlooker to it. 
					
					 It is the DPRK's revolutionary principle governing the struggle against enemies to cope with their hard-line policy with the toughest policy. 
					
					 Should the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppets dare provoke the war, the army and people of the DPRK will give fullest play to all military potentials to mercilessly wipe out the enemies and successfully accomplish the historic cause of national reunification.  
					
					 They would be well advised to behave themselves, facing up to the firm will of the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Tough Stand against Hostile Forces' Moves
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on DPRK's Tough Stand against Hostile Forces' Moves
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The United Nations Security Council is resorting to the sanctions against the DPRK after adopting a brigandish "presidential statement" critical of the DPRK's satellite launch while being embroiled in the hostile forces' anti-DPRK smear campaign. The reality evidently shows that the UNSC is dancing after the tune of the U.S. and, consequently, the principle of sovereignty equality and impartiality, stipulated in the UN Charter, remain in name only and the theory of strength can work on in international arena.
					 Rodong Sinmun today says this in a signed commentary.
					
					 Charging that such hostile forces as the U.S. and Japan are still now asserting the DPRK's satellite launch to be a "ballistic missile launch" and slandering its self-defensive countermeasure as "brinkmanship," the commentary says:
					
					 The conclusions and lessons we drew from the present developments are that the hostile forces' moves to isolate and stifle the DPRK are getting more grave and dangerous on a worldwide scale, the sovereignty can be defended only by strength in the present international relations, it was quite right that the DPRK took the road of bolstering up its nuclear deterrent, and each nation should be responsible for its own destiny and defend it to the last, taking the independent stand as a weapon.
					
					 The viewpoint the DPRK got after studying the tendency of the Obama administration's policy toward the DPRK in 100 days of its emergence is that this administration is little different from the former Bush administration which had persisted in the policy to isolate and stifle the DPRK.
					
					 Invariably keeping the independent stand full of confidence, the DPRK will decisively contain the hostile forces' anti-DPRK sanctions and smear campaign with its toughest action.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group's Crackdown upon S. Korean People Flayed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group's Crackdown upon S. Korean People Flayed
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of traitor's reckless suppression of the people from all walks of  life of south Korea who participated in the anti-"government" struggle waged on the occasion of May Day, the lapse of one year since the candlelight actions and 100 days since the tragic death of evacuees in Ryongsan is nothing but a hideous tyrannical action to quell the will and demand of the people by violence and prolong the remaining days of Lee's political career as it disclosed once again the unpopular and fascist nature of the dictatorship enforced under the signboard of "pragmatism".
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday observes this in a signed commentary:
					
					 South Korea has turned into a huge prison, a living hell and a tundra of democracy due to the above-said dictatorship. It is natural for the south Korean people to struggle to get rid of these shackles as they are totally denied political rights as human beings and subject to hard living. And they can never be the target of suppression. 
					
					 This being hard facts, the Lee group of traitors is cracking down upon those people on charges of being "criminals". 
					
					 The brutal suppression perpetrated by fascists in various parts of south Korea where protests took place clearly indicates that the group of ferocious dictators and the blood-thirsty hooligans represent the Lee group.
					
					 The Lee group of traitors' shuddering crackdown upon the massive anti-"government" struggle of the south Korean people is nothing but a revelation of the traitors' consciousness of crisis.
					
					 Numbered are the days of those who are hell-bent on dictatorship and suppression, resorting to violence to dampen the will and aspiration of the popular masses.
					
					 An ultimate victory is in store for the south Korean people struggling for justice.

articles.title: Puppet Group's Fascist Suppression of  Pro-Reunification Organization Denounced in S. Korea
articles.content:
Puppet Group's Fascist Suppression of Pro-Reunification Organization Denounced in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party, the Democratic Party and other opposition parties of south Korea bitterly condemned the puppet Intelligence Service and police for their fascist suppression of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on May 7.
					 The opposition parties accused the IS and police of searching office rooms of the headquarters and its affiliated organizations and houses of its leading members and arresting six of them including its chairman.
					
					 Chiding the Lee Myung Bak regime for trying to arrest all the forces opposed to it, they stated that this is a wanton violation of democracy and a charade intended to recover a shameful defeat it sustained in the recent "by-election of National Assemblymen."
					
					 The rights of those related to the reunification movement are mercilessly violated due to the regime opposed to reunification, they noted, holding that the past history in which the reunification movement was suppressed due to the departed soul of those who advocated "the theory of coloring" should never be allowed to repeat itself.

articles.title: Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Pakistan
articles.content:
Centenary of Birth of Kim Il Sung to Be Commemorated in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Pakistani preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on May 3.
					 A minister of the Sind State Government was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at its inaugural meeting.
					
					 A resolution adopted at the meeting elaborated on the formation purposes of the committee and its action program and called upon the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people the world over to form similar committees so as to splendidly commemorate the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam arriba a Harare
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam arriba a Harare
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, llego el dia 11 a Harare en compania del ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun y otros para realizar una visita a la Republica de Zimbabwe. 
					  En el aeropuerto Kim y su comitiva fueron acogidos por el vicepresidente Joyce Teurai Ropa Mujuru, el premier Morgan Richard Tsvangirai, los viceprimeros ministros Arthur Guseni Mutambara y Thokozani Khupe, el canciller Simbarashe Mumbengegwi, el ministro de Industria y Comercio Welshman Ncube, y los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en ese pais africano.
					
					  En la terminal aerea se realizo la ceremonia de bienvenida a Kim Yong Nam.
					
					  Kim publico la declaracion de llegada.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam conversa con Robert G. Mugabe
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam conversa con Robert G. Mugabe
 Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar la vispera en el palacio presidencial las conversaciones entre el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, y el presidente de la Republica de Zimbabwe, Robert G. Mugabe.
					  En la ocasion, el mandatario africano expreso su infinita veneracion al Presidente Kim Il Sung quien envio apoyo y respaldo activos a la lucha de su pueblo por la liberacion nacional y la construccion de una nueva sociedad.
					
					  Tras felicitar el lanzamiento exitoso de satelite artificial y otros exitos alcanzados por Corea, subrayo que estos inspiran en los zimbabweyanos la conviccion y el coraje.
					
					  Destaco que la politica de Songun (priorizacion militar) es la justa que ellos deben aprender.
					
					  En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron los criterios sobre el fortalecimiento de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion de larga historia entre los dos paises y otros problemas de interes mutuo.
					
					 Estuvieron presentes tambien el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun y el embajador coreano en este pais africano An Hui Jong asi como el canciller zimbabweyano Simbarashe Mumbengegwi.

articles.title: Robert G. Mugabe ofrece banquete en honor de Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Robert G. Mugabe ofrece banquete en honor de Kim Yong Nam
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Robert G. Mugabe, presidente de la Republica de Zimbabwe, ofrecio el dia 11 en el Palacio Presidencial un banquete en honor de Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea quien realiza una visita a este pais africano.
					  Al convite fueron invitados ademas de Kim el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el embajador coreano en este pais africano An Hui Jong y otros acompanantes.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes el presidente Robert G. Mugabe, el vicepresidente Joyce Teurai Ropa Mujuru, los viceprimeros ministros, el canciller, el ministro de Justicia, los comandantes del ejercito, el inspector general de policia y otros, los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises en ese pais.
					
					  En su discurso pronunciado en esa ocasion, Robert G. Mugabe dijo que agradecia al gobierno y el pueblo de la RPDC que dieron el gran apoyo y respaldo a la lucha del gobierno y el pueblo de Zimbabwe por la independencia del pais y la construccion de la nueva sociedad.
					
					  Continuo que la idea revolucionaria del Presidente Kim Il Sung infunde siempre la conviccion y el estimulo a la lucha de su pueblo y el vivira eternamente a lo largo de la historia.
					
					  Agrego que esta alegre de que las relaciones entre los dos paises se desarrollan cada dia mas favorablemente y expreso la voluntad de esforzarse activamente por su fortalecimiento.
					
					  Al hacer uso de la palabra, Kim Yong Nam senalo que aunque Corea y Zimbabwe estan geograficamente lejos, han venido desarrollando las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion teniendo establecidos desde hace mucho tiempo los estrechos lazos de amistad.
					
					  Se refirio a que el Presidente Kim Il Sung, al considerar al Presidente Robert G. Mugabe como intimo amigo y camarada de armas, envio el apoyo y respaldo material y espiritual a la lucha del pueblo zimbabweyano por la liberacion nacional y la construccion de nueva sociedad.
					
					  Agrego que Corea se opone a toda clase de sanciones e intervenciones en los asuntos internos de Zimbabwe y apoya los esfuerzos del gobierno y el pueblo de Zimbabwe por lograr la estabilidad politica y el desarrollo economico.
					
					  Enfatizo que en el futuro tambien se esforzara activamente por desarrollar en varios dominios las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.

articles.title: Efectuada la conferencia de ciudades hermanadas Corea-China
articles.content:
fectuada la conferencia de ciudades hermanadas Corea-China
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 12 en esta capital la conferencia de las ciudades hermanadas Corea-China.
					  En la ocasion participaron el presidente interino del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero (CRCE) y presidente de la Federacion de las Ciudades de Corea (FCC), Mun Jae Chol, el vicepresidente del CRCE, Jon Yong Jin, los delegados del CRCE y la FCC, los representantes de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur, la de Kangwon, la de Phyong-an del Sur, la ciudad de Rason, la de Nampho, la de Hamhung, la de Chongjin y el municipio de Mangyongdae de la ciudad de Pyongyang, que establecieron las relaciones de amistad con las ciudades chinas, y los funcionarios correspondientes.
					
					  Tambien participaron la delegacion de la Asociacion de Amistad China-Corea presidida por su titular Wu Donghe, los delegados de las provincias de Jiangsu, de Shandong y de Sicuani, la ciudad de Shanghai, la de Jilin, la de Hunchun y la de Changchun y el embajador chino en Corea, Liu Xiaoming.
					
					  Mun Jae Chol, en su informe, senalo que desde que se establecieron hace 60 anos las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China, las ciudades de ambos paises contribuyeron sustancialmente al desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China a traves del intercambio y la cooperacion en varias ramas.
					
					  Luego del establecimiento en 1982 de las relaciones de amistad entre la ciudad coreana de Hamhung y la china de Shanghai, fueron hermanadas otras ciudades incluyendo la provincia de Kangwon y la de Jiangsu, la de Hwanghae del Sur y la de Shandong, la de Phyong-an del Sur y la de Sichuan, el municipio de Mangyongdae de la ciudad de Pyongyang y la de Jilin de la provincia homonima, recordo.
					
					  Deseo que las ciudades hermanadas contribuyan activamente a celebrar significativamente el "ano de amistad Corea-China" y a consolidar esta amistad, valiosa riqueza comun de los pueblos de los dos paises, a traves de las peculiares actividades de intercambio.
					
					Le siguio en usar la palabra Wu Donghe quien destaco la importancia especial que tiene la celebracion de esta conferencia en Pyongyang en el "ano de amistad China-Corea", en que se cumplen los 60 anos del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre ambas partes.
					
					Subrayo que el intercambio y la cooperacion entre las ciudades hermanadas, que se realizaron bajo la profunda atencion de los lideres y los gobiernos de los dos paises, contribuyeron de modo activo a la continuacion y al desarrollo de la tradicional amistad China-Corea.
					
					Deseo de todo corazon al pueblo coreano la realizacion de la ambiciosa meta de abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera en 2012, presentada por el camarada Secretario General Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Luego del discurso congratulatorio del embajador chino, accedieron al microfono los delegados del Comite Popular de la provincia de Hwanghae del Sur y del Comite Popular del Municipio de Mangyongdae de la ciudad de Pyongyang de la RPDC y del Gobierno Popular de la Provincia de Shandong y la Asociacion de Amistad del Pueblo con el Extranjero de la Ciudad de Jilin de la provincia homonima de la RPCh.
					
					En la ocasion fue publicado el comunicado conjunto.
					
					Segun este documento, la conferencia efectuada por primera vez en la historia de las relaciones de amistad Corea-China recordo la historia y las tradiciones de amistad y destaco que la amistad bilateral es el bien comun de ambos pueblos preparado por el gran Lider del pueblo coreano, camarada Kim Il Sung y el gran Lider del pueblo chino, camarada Mao Zedong y otros revolucionarios de veterana generacion.
					
					En el conclave se expuso la determinacion de contribuir activamente a celebrar el significativo "ano de amistad Corea-China" al desarrollar entre las ciudades de amistad en el principio de beneficio mutuo el intercambio y la cooperacion conforme a la esperanza de los maximos dirigentes de ambos paises.
					
					El mismo dia, el CRCE y la FCC ofrecieron en el Restaurante Chongryu un banquete con motivo de la citada conferencia.
